title: Electric potential two positive point charges

content.question: Two positive point charges, both of magnitude <math alttext="4.0 times 10 to the power negative 6 coulombs" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>4.0</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>6</mn></mrow></msup><mtext> C</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> , are situated along the <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> -axis at <math alttext="x sub 1 equals negative 2.0 meters " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mo>−</mo><mn>2.0</mn><mtext> m</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="x sub 2 equals positive 2.0 meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>2.0</mn><mtext> m</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> . What is the electric potential at the origin of the <math alttext="x y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> - coordinate system?

choices.label: <math alttext="negative 3.6 times 10 to the power 4 volts" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>3.6</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup><mtext> V</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="negative 1.8 times 10 to the power 4 volts" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1.8</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup><mtext> V</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="1.8 times 10 to the power 4 volts" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>1.8</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup><mtext> V</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="3.6 times 10 to the power 4 volts" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>3.6</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup><mtext> V</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="3.6 times 10 to the power 4 volts" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>3.6</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup><mtext> V</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
